refnamediv.refpurpose: basic atomic integer and pointer operations

refsynopsisdiv.title: Synopsis

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: The following functions can be used to atomically access integers and pointers. They are implemented as inline assembler function on most platforms and use slower fall-backs otherwise. Using them can sometimes save you from using a performance-expensive GMutex to protect the integer or pointer.
The most important usage is reference counting. Using g_atomic_int_inc() and g_atomic_int_dec_and_test() makes reference counting a very fast operation.

note.para: You must not directly read integers or pointers concurrently accessed by other threads with with the following functions directly. Always use g_atomic_int_get() and g_atomic_pointer_get() respectively. They are acting as a memory barrier.

If you are using those functions for anything apart from simple reference counting, you should really be aware of the implications of doing that. There are literally thousands of ways to shoot yourself in the foot. So if in doubt, use a GMutex. If you don't know, what memory barriers are, do not use anything but g_atomic_int_inc() and g_atomic_int_dec_and_test().

It is not safe to set an integer or pointer just by assigning to it, when it is concurrently accessed by other threads with the following functions. Use g_atomic_int_compare_and_exchange() or g_atomic_pointer_compare_and_exchange() respectively.

refsect2.title: g_atomic_int_get ()
refsect2.para: Reads the value of the integer pointed to by atomic. Also acts as a memory barrier.

refsect2.title: g_atomic_int_add ()
refsect2.para: Atomically adds val to the integer pointed to by atomic. Also acts as a memory barrier.

refsect2.title: g_atomic_int_exchange_and_add ()
refsect2.para: Atomically adds val to the integer pointed to by atomic. It returns the value of *atomic just before the addition took place. Also acts as a memory barrier.

listitem.simpara: the value of *atomic before the addition.

refsect2.title: g_atomic_int_compare_and_exchange ()
refsect2.programlisting: gboolean g_atomic_int_compare_and_exchange (gint *atomic, gint oldval, gint newval);
refsect2.para: Compares oldval with the integer pointed to by atomic and if they are equal, atomically exchanges *atomic with newval. Also acts as a memory barrier.

listitem.simpara: TRUE, if *atomic was equal oldval. FALSE otherwise.

refsect2.title: g_atomic_pointer_get ()
refsect2.para: Reads the value of the pointer pointed to by atomic. Also acts as a memory barrier.

refsect2.title: g_atomic_pointer_compare_and_exchange ()
refsect2.programlisting: gboolean g_atomic_pointer_compare_and_exchange (gpointer *atomic, gpointer oldval, gpointer newval);
refsect2.para: Compares oldval with the pointer pointed to by atomic and if they are equal, atomically exchanges *atomic with newval. Also acts as a memory barrier.

listitem.simpara: TRUE, if *atomic was equal oldval. FALSE otherwise.

refsect2.title: g_atomic_int_inc ()
refsect2.para: Atomically increments the integer pointed to by atomic by 1.

refsect2.title: g_atomic_int_dec_and_test ()
refsect2.para: Atomically decrements the integer pointed to by atomic by 1.

listitem.simpara: TRUE, if the integer pointed to by atomic is 0 after decrementing it.
